image.altText: An elderly couple is seen in Melbourne, with a walking stick and umbrealla.

props.synopsis: A taskforce reviewing funding for aged care has rejected the idea of a tax levy to cover the sector's costs and instead suggested Australians accessing care should pay more based on their personal wealth.

title.children: Taskforce rejects aged care levy, pointing to demographic change and intergenerational equity

image.altText: A white man in his thirties sits on a car outside a brick building.

props.synopsis: With rising costs of fuel, vehicle prices and insurance, combined with a rising cost of living, driving is becoming increasingly unaffordable, especially for those in regional Australia.

title.children: James used to drive to save time and money. He says owning a car is no longer what it's cracked up to be

image.altText: Woman holding and looking at a glass of water in a kitchen.

props.synopsis: In a regional town just a few hours from Adelaide, an ongoing water crisis means the locals and their animals won't drink the tap water — yet residents are paying the same rates as residents in the city.

title.children: In this South Australian town even the dogs won't drink the corrosive water

image.altText: Marles, wearing a sport jacket labelled 'Korea', shakes hands with a man in a suit, both smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: A former South Korean defence minister implicated in a corruption investigation over the death of a soldier has arrived in Australia to take up his controversial appointment as ambassador.

title.children: Diplomatic headache as Korean ambassador flies into Australia despite local corruption probe

image.altText: A Ukrainian solider holds a gun while looking at the camera. In the background, several soldiers are climbing on to a truck

props.synopsis: Ukraine's president Volodymyr Zelenskyy has suggested a counteroffensive may be launched this year. But to plan, prepare and execute such a strategy will be an enormous undertaking with three key challenges, writes Mick Ryan.

title.children: Ukraine is planning a counteroffensive against Russia. Can it succeed?

image.altText: An illustration of a woman unable to sleep at night

props.synopsis: An oppressive heatwave over the south-eastern part of the country has felled temperature records and while autumn is no stranger to hot weather, experts say what we're seeing is part of a growing trend.

title.children: The real risk behind this record-breaking autumn heatwave and what we can expect in the future

image.altText: Narendra Modi looks directly into camera while wearing rimless glasses and a beige stole

props.synopsis: One of the most powerful people in the world, Narendra Modi is running for a rare third term as India's prime minister. But much of his life has been shrouded in mystery. These hidden chapters tell the true story.

title.children: A secret wife, a mysterious past and an astonishing rise to power: Who exactly is Narendra Modi?

image.altText: Young protesters hold signs and yell while raising their fists at a protest

props.synopsis: The Indian government moves to implement legislation that fast-tracks naturalisation for people who have fled from Afghanistan, Bangladesh and Pakistan but excludes Muslims from the countries.

title.children: India moves to implement citizenship law that excludes Muslims

image.altText: Image shows congestion and traffic delays. You can see cars, grey road on a gloomy day.

props.synopsis: Amongst the furore and fallout among car manufacturers and Australia's new emissions laws, a separate split is developing over EV technology that could determine the future of our new critical minerals quest, writes Ian Verrender.

title.children: Why petrol is making a temporary comeback in the battle with EVs

image.altText: A close up looking over the shoulder of a woman using her mobile phone on the platform of the train station.

props.synopsis: As Australia's 3G networks are retired, 4G phones without VoLTE and some regional customers are likely to be impacted.

title.children: Concerns for some 4G phones, regional customers as 3G networks shut down

image.altText: A small baby in an incubator connected to tubes and their hand clutched around someones finger.

props.synopsis: A 19-year-old mother who watched her first baby die believes her concerns were disregarded by Mackay hospital staff, an experience bearing a striking resemblance to a case revealed at the hospital's last damning investigation in 2022.

title.children: Young mother who lost her newborn says hospital staff didn't listen because of her age

image.altText: Close up photo of Derek Bromley as a middle-aged man, wearing blue cap and blue shirt, smiling.

props.synopsis: In 1984 Derek Bromley was convicted of murdering Adelaide man Stephen Docoza, a crime Bromley has always denied committing. This month brings fresh hope to him and his advocates.

title.children: For 40 years Derek Bromley has been jailed for a crime he says he didn't commit. This month everything might change

image.altText: Police cars in a car park

props.synopsis: A 23-year-old Redbank Plains man has been charged with murder following an extensive manhunt and homicide investigation on the Gold Coast.

title.children: Man, 23, charged with murder following major manhunt in affluent Gold Coast suburb

image.altText: A graphic showing a artistic impression of a red-coloured dead mouse lying on its back in front of prison bars.

props.synopsis: As the Northern Territory's prison population reaches record levels, two former inmates from opposite ends of the territory speak out about the "dehumanising" conditions inside NT jails.

title.children: Dead mice and overcrowding: Former inmates describe 'dehumanising' life inside NT prisons

image.altText: Containers with goat curry and rice topped with fresh coriander and chilli lined up on a benchtop

props.synopsis: If you've never cooked with goat before, those in the know say it's easy to learn to love cooking with the red meat.

title.children: Simple, delicious ways to start cooking with goat meat

image.altText: Seven young people holding big yellow letters that spell out 'Heywire' and jumping on grass in front of parliament house

props.synopsis: Here are six ideas to improve the lives of young people living in regional Australia, according to 31 winners of the ABC's Heywire competition who travelled to Canberra to share their ideas for change.

title.children: Public transport, quality education, connection to country among the ideas to improve young lives in regional Australia

props.synopsis: After blazing its way through awards season, the blockbuster biopic Oppenheimer took home the most Oscar trophies this year, including best picture. Here's how it ranks among the top Oscar-winning films of all time.

title.children: Oppenheimer dominated the 2024 Academy Awards. But did it break the record for most Oscar wins of all time?

image.altText: A young man carries an elderly woman through floodwaters

props.synopsis: At least 26 people have been killed and 11 others are missing after torrential rain caused flash flooding on the Indonesian island of Sumatra.

title.children: At least 26 killed, 11 missing after flash floods and landslides in Indonesia

image.altText: a burned out unit

props.synopsis: A body is found in the fire-ravaged home of an 83-year-old man after a blaze at a Burpengary retirement community.

title.children: Body found after fire at retirement village north of Brisbane

image.altText: A close up of two inconsistences in a photo

props.synopsis: The stakes of a Princess Catherine photo could not have been higher amid a swirl of speculation. But instead of avoiding a media storm, the House of Windsor is now caught up in a hurricane of coverage, with no certainty about when it will blow over, writes Rebecca Armitage and Lucia Stein.

title.children: Kate and William made two choices that turned their PR nightmare into an unmitigated disaster

image.altText: A woman sitting an smiling surrounded by three children, who are also smiling

props.synopsis: The Princess of Wales responds to speculation over inconsistencies in a photo published to the royals' social media channels to mark Mother's Day in the UK.

title.children: Princess of Wales apologises over royal photoshop fail, saying she 'experimented with editing'

image.altText: Andre Rivett is the first down syndrome athlete to represent Australia in athletics (Jessica Stewart, ABC News)

props.synopsis: Queenslander Andre Rivett heads to the Trisome Games in Türkiye looking to claim gold in the discus, shot-put, and javelin.

title.children: Andre will be Australia's only competitor at the Trisome Games — and he has a secret weapon

image.altText: A man wearing an open-necked shirt and suit jacket gestures.

props.synopsis: Federal cabinet minister Ed Husic tells Q+A Israel has refused to listen to "not just reasonable but vital calls" to aid to be delivered to people in Gaza.

title.children: Israel refusing to listen on Gaza aid need: minister

image.altText: A drone view of a big stadium

props.synopsis: After two decades, five stages and $340 million in funding, the revamp of Geelong's Kardinia Park stadium is near complete. A local historian says in many ways, the sometimes-controversial precinct is the "glue" that holds the coastal community together.

title.children: As Victoria's second-biggest city has reversed its fortunes, this historical stadium has been given new life

image.altText: sheep in the yards at a farm

props.synopsis: For one of the most successful footballers of the modern era, farming provides the perfect relief to the high-pressured environment of elite sport.

title.children: How AFL superstar Tom Hawkins balances family, farming and football

image.altText: A plane with the LATAM Airlines logo flying

props.synopsis: Fifty people have been injured after a "technical problem" on a LATAM Airlines flight from Sydney to Auckland.

title.children: Fifty people injured after 'technical problem' on Sydney to Auckland flight

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: police arrest two people in busy Sydney street

props.synopsis: The 73-year-old NSW man and his 58-year-old partner have been charged with several counts of child grooming including aggravated incite person to do sexual acts.

title.children: Religious cult leader William Kamm groomed child from prison using partner, police say

image.altText: Fred Again performing at Laneway Festival hunched over DJ decks with red lighting behind him

props.synopsis: triple j Hack has seen a private online forum where hundreds of people were involved in a coordinated ticket-scalping campaign using bots to buy tickets to Fred again..'s Australian shows and sell them at inflated prices.

title.children: Coordinated bot campaign snapped up Fred again.. tickets before you even had a chance

image.altText: A pig seen lying on the ground at a piggery.

props.synopsis: Secret recordings show the legal but inhumane way piglets are killed in Victoria but also lead to a man being charged with bestiality.

title.children: Allegations of animal cruelty and a bestiality charge at Victorian piggery

image.altText: Sydney Roosters prop Spencer Leniu wears a suit as he walks into his NRL judiciary hearing.

props.synopsis: The NRL judiciary panel rejects requests from Spencer Leniu's team for a four-match ban, opting to suspend the Roosters prop until round 10.

title.children: Racial slur in Las Vegas sees Spencer Leniu out for eight games

image.altText: Crates of fresh food and shelves with perishable items inside Foodbank's Ballarat distribution centre

props.synopsis: After being delayed by more than a year, one of Foodbank's new regional Victorian distribution centres will pilot a program allowing students experiencing food insecurity to shop for free.

title.children: Charity to trial student 'supermarket' offering free groceries as demand for food relief surges

image.altText: A slow shutter photograph showing a blurry market trading board at the Australia Securities Exchange.

props.synopsis: Concerns are emerging that financial markets and households need a reality check when it comes to the outlook on inflation and interest rates.

title.children: Financial markets plummet amid rumblings inflation and interest rates could rise again

image.altText: A helicopter flies over a smoking city as two people in shadow watch from the foregound.

props.synopsis: Israel is checking if Hamas's second-highest military leader died in an air strike, local media reports, as talks stumble to secure a ceasefire in the Gaza war to coincide with the Muslim holy month of Ramadan.

title.children: Israel checking if Hamas military number 2 killed in Gaza strike

props.synopsis:
In short: At least 26 people have been killed and 11 others are missing after flash flooding and landslides in Indonesia.
Heavy rains sparked the emergency on the island of Sumatra in recent days.
What's next? Rescuers are continuing their efforts as floodwaters recede.

title.children: Indonesia flooding

image.altText: Photo of a toddler with blonde curly hair.

props.synopsis: Rashelle's life changed forever when her one-year-old daughter Lilly died after a fall at a childcare centre. But closure has been hard to come by due to multiple reports leaving her cause of death undetermined.

title.children: Ten hours after hitting her head at child care, Lilly was dead, leaving her family wanting answers
